intro: Erysimum flaviflorum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves and flowering stems. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Erysimum flaviflorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
